metadata.title: CVE-2022-1198 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerabilitity was discovered indrivers/net/hamradio/6pack.c of linux that allows an attacker to crashlinux kernel by simulating ax25 device using 6pack driver from user space.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1198` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-189-generic - 4.15.0-189.200
linux-image-4.15.0-189-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-189.200
linux-image-4.15.0-189-lowlatency - 4.15.0-189.200
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-189-generic - 4.15.0-189.200
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-189-lowlatency - 4.15.0-189.200
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-117-generic - 5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-117-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-117-lowlatency - 5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-117-generic - 5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-117-lowlatency - 5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-189.200').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.128').
